nodes.name: Escrow

nodes.documentation:
@notice Checks if loan is active. 
@return true in case loan is active.
nodes.name: isLoanActive

nodes.documentation:
@notice It calls a given dapp using a delegatecall function by a borrower owned the current loan id associated to this escrow contract.
@param dappData the current dapp data to be executed.
nodes.name: callDapp

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) view external returns (struct TellerCommon.Loan memory)

nodes.documentation:
@notice Gets the borrower for this Escrow's loan.
@return address of this Escrow's loans
nodes.name: getBorrower

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) view external returns (struct TellerCommon.Loan memory)

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns this Escrow's loan instance.
nodes.name: getLoan

nodes.documentation:
@notice Calculate this Escrow instance total value. 
@return This Escrow instance total value expressed in ETH and Token value.

devdoc.author: develop@teller.finance
devdoc.details: The current DApp implementations are: Uniswap and Compound.

calculateTotalValue().return: This Escrow instance total value expressed in ETH and Token value.

params.dappData: the current dapp data to be executed.

canPurchase().return: true if loan can be liquidated.

initialize(address).details: Initializes the contract setting the deployer as the initial owner.

params.aLoanID: the loan ID associated to this escrow instance.

initialized().return: true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false.

isLoanActive().return: true in case loan is active.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

isUnderValued().return: true if this escrow loan is undervalued based on its token price.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

purchaseLoanDebt().details: Events are emitted when repay() and _transferOwnership().

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

settings().details: This address should NOT change over the time. See details in the _setSettings(...) function.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns this contract's balance for the specified token.

calculateTotalValue().notice: Calculate this Escrow instance total value.

callDapp((address,bytes)).notice: It calls a given dapp using a delegatecall function by a borrower owned the current loan id associated to this escrow contract.

canPurchase().notice: Checks if current Escrow instance loan can be liquidated.

getBorrower().notice: Gets the borrower for this Escrow's loan.

initialize(address,uint256).notice: It initializes this escrow instance for a given loans address and loan id.

initialized().notice: Gets if the contract is initialized.

isUnderValued().notice: Checks if this Escrow loan value is undervalued based its token price.

purchaseLoanDebt().notice: Purchase this Escrow's loan if it is eligible to liquidate and transfers ownership to msg.sender.

settings().notice: The gets the settings contract address from the SETTINGS_SLOT.

userdoc.notice: This contract is used by borrowers to call DApp functions (using delegate calls).This contract should only be constructed using it's upgradeable Proxy contract.In order to call a DApp function, the DApp must be added in the EscrowFactory instance.
